com.xmlmind.ditac.convert

Class ExternalFOConverter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.xmlmind.ditac.convert.ExternalFOConverter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FOConverter

    public final class ExternalFOConverter
extends java.lang.Object
implements FOConverter
    An implementation of FOConverter based on an external command-line utility such as /opt/xep/xep, D:\opt\fop\fop.bat, etc.

      • command

        public final java.lang.String command
        Command to be executed by a /bin/sh on Unix and cmd.exe on Windows.

        This command may contain the following variables which are substituted with their values prior to executing the command:

        Variable Description
        %I The XSL-FO input file.
        %i Same as %I but an URL rather a filename.
        %O The output file.
        %o Same as %O but an URL rather a filename.
        %S Portable filename separator: '\' on Windows, '/' on all the other platforms.

        A variable name may be preceded by one of these modifiers:

        Modifier Description Example
        ~p Parent directory.

        %~pI = C:\Users\john\Documents\doc src

        %~pi = file:/C:/Users/john/Documents/doc%20src/ (note the trailing '/')

        ~n Basename of the file, including the extension.

        %~nI = manual.xml

        %~ni = manual.xml

        ~r Basename of the file, without the extension.

        %~rI = manual

        %~ri = manual

        ~e File extension, if any.

        %~eI = xml

        %~ei = xml

        public ExternalFOConverter(java.lang.String processorName,
                           Format targetFormat,
                           java.lang.String command)
        Constructs an ExternalFOConverter fully initialized using specified arguments.
        Parameters:
        processorName - the name of the XSL-FO processor
        targetFormat - the format generated by the XSL-FO processor
        command - command to be executed to convert the XSL-FO input file to the output format

    • Method Detail

      • getProcessorName

        public java.lang.String getProcessorName()
        Description copied from interface: FOConverter
        Returns the name of this XSL-FO processor, something very short like "FOP", "XEP", "XFC". Note that this name is passed as the value of the foProcessor ``system parameter'' to the XSLT stylesheets that generate XSL-FO.
        Specified by:
        getProcessorName in interface FOConverter

      • getTargetFormat
